intro: Geissorhiza mellimontana, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive orange center. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, underground stem. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
